935dfd0e-9f6d-4b34-87df-bd2699636130.description: Earners of this badge have studied for and passed a rigorous exam covering insect knowledge and principles of Integrated Pest Management. Based on their work experience and references, they represent a truly dedicated subset of Pest Management Professionals. In addition to the exam, badgeholders agree to adhere to a Code of Ethics and continuously improve their knowledge through continuing education.
935dfd0e-9f6d-4b34-87df-bd2699636130.name: ACE Structural Pest Control

issuer.summary: issued by Entomological Society of America

badge_template_activities.title: Badgeholders have taken and passed an exam covering 5 key knowledge domains related to pest management.
Badgeholders have a minimum of 5 years work experience, in addition to being a licensed pesticide applicator.
In order to maintain this credential, badgeholders must submit continuing education unit (CEU) credits every three years.
Badgeholders must also continue to adhere to a code of ethics, ensuring professionalism and accountability.

68518b8d-7819-499e-a619-16a2722aa4a4.description: Earners of this badge have passed two rigorous exams. The core exam covers basics of entomology. The urban/industrial entomology specialty exam covers topics pertaining to structural pest management. Based on their work experience and references, badgeholders represent a truly dedicated subset of professional entomologists. In addition to the exam, they agree to adhere to a Code of Ethics and continuously improve their knowledge through continuing education.
68518b8d-7819-499e-a619-16a2722aa4a4.name: Board Certified Entomologist- Urban/Industrial Entomology

issuer.summary: issued by Entomological Society of America

badge_template_activities.title: All BCEs must take and pass the core qualifying exam.
All BCEs specializing in urban/industrial entomology must take and pass the urban/industrial entomology specialty exam.
All BCEs must have at least a bachelor's degree in entomology or a closely related scientific field.

All BCEs must combine either a bachelor's degree and three years of post-graduate work experience, a master's degree and two years of post-graduate work experience, or a Ph.D. and one year of post-graduate work experience.
Once certified all BCEs must submit a triennial professional maintenance and certification report containing at least 120 continuing education units.
All BCEs are expected to adhere to a strict code of ethics, ensuring their professionalism and dedication to entomology.

4faa419f-9032-43ba-aaec-e159372383e2.description: Earners of this badge have passed two rigorous exams. The core exam covers basics of entomology. The medical/veterinary entomology specialty exam covers entomology relating to arthropods of medical/veterinary importance. Based on their work experience and references, badgeholders represent a truly dedicated subset of professional entomologists. In addition to the exam, they agree to adhere to a Code of Ethics and continuously improve their knowledge through continuing education.
4faa419f-9032-43ba-aaec-e159372383e2.name: Board Certified Entomologist- Medical and Veterinary Entomology

issuer.summary: issued by Entomological Society of America

badge_template_activities.title: All BCEs must take and pass the core qualifying exam.
All BCEs specializing in medical/veterinary entomology must take and pass the medical/veterinary entomology specialty exam.
All BCEs must have at least a bachelor's degree in entomology or a closely related scientific field.

All BCEs must combine either a bachelor's degree and three years of post-graduate work experience, a master's degree and two years of post-graduate work experience, or a Ph.D. and one year of post-graduate work experience.
Once certified all BCEs must submit a triennial professional maintenance and certification report containing at least 120 continuing education units.
All BCEs are expected to adhere to a strict code of ethics, ensuring their professionalism and dedication to entomology.

71de1ed6-1cee-475f-ab22-cc8c39020088.description: Earners of this certificate have studied for and passed a rigorous exam covering insects and the diseases they vector as well as principles of Integrated Pest Management. They represent a dedicated subset of pest management and vector control professionals. In addition to the exam, certificate holders are expected to adhere to a Code of Ethics.
71de1ed6-1cee-475f-ab22-cc8c39020088.name: Public Health Entomology Certificate

issuer.summary: issued by Entomological Society of America

badge_template_activities.title: Badgeholders have taken and passed an exam covering 5 key knowledge domains related to pest management.
Badgeholders have a minimum of 5 years work experience, in addition to being a licensed pesticide applicator.
Badgeholders must also continue to adhere to a code of ethics, ensuring professionalism and accountability

af74e19d-0612-4c2d-a34f-507f1b39efe0.description: Earners of this badge have studied for and passed an exam covering insect knowledge and principles of Integrated Pest Management. In addition to the exam, badgeholders agree to adhere to a Code of Ethics and continuously improve their knowledge through continuing education.
af74e19d-0612-4c2d-a34f-507f1b39efe0.name: Certified IPM Technician

issuer.summary: issued by Entomological Society of America

badge_template_activities.title: Badgeholders have taken and passed an exam covering 5 key knowledge domains related to pest management.
Badgeholders have a minimum of one year of work experience, in addition to being qualified to apply restricted use pesticides in their work jurisdiction
In order to maintain this credential, badgeholders must submit continuing education unit (CEU) credits every year
Badgeholders must also continue to adhere to a code of ethics, ensuring professionalism and accountability.

b5fc524e-78f3-44db-aaf4-e272e0643859.description: Earners of this badge have studied for and passed two rigorous exams. The first covers insect knowledge and principles of Integrated Pest Management and the second covering pesticide safety. Based on their work experience and references, badgeholders represent a truly dedicated subset of Pest Management Professionals. In addition to the exam, they agree to adhere to a Code of Ethics and continuously improve their knowledge through continuing education.
b5fc524e-78f3-44db-aaf4-e272e0643859.name: ACE-International

issuer.summary: issued by Entomological Society of America

badge_template_activities.title: Badgeholders have taken and passed an exam covering 5 key knowledge domains related to pest management, as well as an additional exam covering pesticide safety.
Badgeholders have a minimum of 5 years work experience.
In order to maintain this credential, badgeholders must submit continuing education unit (CEU) credits every three years.
Badgeholders must also continue to adhere to a code of ethics, ensuring professionalism and accountability.

8f5d9270-e02c-4642-8bbf-d029527e82a7.description: Earners of this badge have passed two rigorous exams. The core exam covers basics of entomology. The general entomology specialty exam covers broad entomology topics in more detail. Based on their work experience and references, they represent a truly dedicated subset of professional entomologists. In addition to the exam, badgeholders agree to adhere to a Code of Ethics and continuously improve their knowledge through continuing education.
8f5d9270-e02c-4642-8bbf-d029527e82a7.name: Board Certified Entomologist- General Entomology

issuer.summary: issued by Entomological Society of America

badge_template_activities.title: All BCEs must take and pass the core qualifying exam.
All BCEs specializing in general entomology must take and pass the general entomology specialty exam.
All BCEs must have at least a bachelor's degree in entomology or a closely related scientific field.

All BCEs must combine either a bachelor's degree and three years of post-graduate work experience, a master's degree and two years of post graduate work experience, or a PhD and one year of post graduate work experience.
Once certified all BCEs must submit a triennial professional maintenance and certification report containing at least 120 continuing education units.
All BCEs are expected to adhere to a strict code of ethics, ensuring their professionalism and dedication to entomology.

45533ff7-8e75-40cd-84ef-b8619d04b950.description: Earners of the Professional Advancement Career Training (PACT) Certificate, offered by the Entomological Society of America, have completed a six-month training in soft skill and leadership development.
45533ff7-8e75-40cd-84ef-b8619d04b950.name: Professional Advancement Career Training (PACT) Certificate

issuer.summary: issued by Entomological Society of America

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge must complete a six-month training program organized around monthly themes, which includes monthly one-on-one mentoring meetings, webinars, curated reading content, and small group discussions.

4dbd53e1-b788-4e1e-8d4e-e9a3ab97c738.description: Earners of this badge have passed two rigorous exams. The core exam covers basics of entomology. The plant-related entomology specialty exam covers entomology as it relates to crops, gardens, and forestry. Based on their work experience and references, badgeholders represent a truly dedicated subset of professional entomologists. In addition to the exam, they agree to adhere to a Code of Ethics and continuously improve their knowledge through continuing education.
4dbd53e1-b788-4e1e-8d4e-e9a3ab97c738.name: Board Certified Entomologist- Plant-Related Entomology

All BCEs must combine either a bachelor's degree and three years of post-graduate work experience, a master's degree and two years of post graduate work experience, or a Ph.D and one year of post graduate work experience.
Once certified all BCEs must submit a triennial professional maintenance and certification report containing at least 120 continuing education units.
All BCEs are expected to adhere to a strict code of ethics, ensuring their professionalism and dedication to entomology.

1f6728d5-25ca-495d-9991-e5f6c2943e4b.description: Earners of this badge have passed two rigorous exams. The core exam covers basics of entomology. The pesticide development, analysis, and toxicity entomology specialty exam covers entomology topics related to pesticides. Based on their work experience and references, badgeholders represent a truly dedicated subset of professional entomologists. In addition to the exam, they agree to adhere to a Code of Ethics and continuously improve their knowledge through continuing education.
1f6728d5-25ca-495d-9991-e5f6c2943e4b.name: Board Certified Entomologist- Pesticide Development, Analysis and Toxicology

All BCEs must have at least a bachelor's degree in entomology or a closely related scientific field.

All BCEs must combine either a bachelor's degree and three years of post-graduate work experience, a master's degree and two years of post-graduate work experience, or a Ph.D. and one year of post-graduate work experience.
Once certified all BCEs must submit a triennial professional maintenance and certification report containing at least 120 continuing education units.
All BCEs are expected to adhere to a strict code of ethics, ensuring their professionalism and dedication to entomology.

8855f454-14df-4fc6-8ef3-e2c5fd6a42d3.description: Earners of this badge have passed two rigorous exams. The core exam covers basics of entomology. The regulatory entomology specialty exam covers topics related to U.S. federal law as they relate to arthropods, pesticides, and entomology. Based on their work experience and references, badgeholders represent a truly dedicated subset of professional entomologists. In addition to the exam, they agree to adhere to a Code of Ethics and continuously improve their knowledge through continuing education.

246ca3ce-750f-4d98-9db1-24a762052b32.description: Honorary Membership recognizes extraordinary service by ESA members who have had significant involvement in the affairs of the Society for at least 20 years.

issuer.summary: issued by Entomological Society of America

badge_template_activities.title: Honorary Membership recognizes extraordinary service by ESA members who have had significant involvement in the affairs of the Society for at least 20 years.

skills.name: High Level of Involvement with the Society

52832766-ef96-44a9-bf64-c0c9366f3336.description: Fellows of ESA are individuals who have made outstanding contributions to entomology— via research, teaching, extension, administration, military service, and public engagement and science policy —and whose career accomplishments serve to inspire all entomologists.
